From: " 
To:'  " 
Cc: "I 
 r 
Subject: RE: Epstein search materials for upload and privilege review 
Date: Tue, 03 Mar 2020 17:58:16 +0000 
Circling back on this, both in terms of moving the documents and de-duping —  there are an absolutely insane amount of 
repeat dots. Please let us know the status? Thanks. 
From: 
Sent: Saturday, February 22, 2020 19:25 
To: =''; 
Cc: 
ca; 
Subject: RE: Epstein search materials for upload and privilege review 
Also we really need to get these results de-duped —  there are *tons* of repeat documents. 
From: 
Sent: Saturday, February 22, 2020 19:22 
To:
Cc:
Subject: RE: Epstein search materials for upload and privilege review 
Totally understand it's voluminous, but we do to need to move it because otherwise our searching process will be all 
messed up —  we won't be able to run terms through all search warrant returns (instead, we'd have to duplicate literally 
every search across two different huge folders). And it doesn't work to just search all materials in the entire file because 
the FBI case file is also huge. 
If going forward there is any question at all on where things should go in the folder structure, we're more than happy to 
provide guidance on that. 
From: 
Sent: Friday, February 21, 2020 17:04 
To: 
cj
Cc: 
Subject: Re: Epstein search materials for upload and privilege 
review 
Moving may be an issue, PAE had trouble releasing the data because they were so voluminous. 
EFTA00020839

On Feb 21, 2020, at 4:55 PM, 
)< 
wrote: 
Ah, possibly it's the "2020-01-23" folder under Subpoena Returns? If so, =, can we please (1) move that to under the 
Search Warrant Returns folder, and (2) if at all possible, combine the 37 different subfolders into one? There doesn't 
appear to be any distinction between all of those folders so I don't think there's any utility in having so many subgroups. 
But let us know if (2) is a problem and happy to discuss. 
From: 
Sent: Friday, February 21, 2020 16:53 
To: 
I 
Cc: 
/ 1 
>; 
Subject: RE: Epstein search materials for upload and privilege review 
I think they are in the Subpoena Returns folder, which I thought was strange. I'm heading to now but will log in 
after that to find them. 
From: 
< 
Sent: Friday, February 21, 2020 4:32 PM 
To: 
Cc: 
Subject: RE: Epstein search materials for upload and privilege review 
I 
>; 
just tried calling but didn't catch you — I don't see where these are located in Relativity? I think they should be 
under "Search Warrant Returns" but I don't see them there (or anywhere else under the Epstein overall folder). Let me 
know if I've just missed them, which is entirely possible, or if they're not accessible to us yet? Thank you! 
From: 
Sent: Thursday, February 20, 2020 21:12 
To: 
Cc: 
›; 
Subject: Re: Epstein search materials for upload and privilege review 
The NP folder has been released. 
On Feb 20, 2020, at 2:28 PM, 
> 
wrote: 
Here's the STR and the data should be released soon, it's just taking a  while because the load is so large. 
EFTA00020840

From: 
Sent: Thursday, February 20, 2020 11:42 AM 
To: 
Cc:
Subject: RE: Epstein search materials for upload and privilege review 
New data is loaded and we've segregated the PP hits; you should have access to the new data today. Will keep you 
posted. 
Thanks, 
From: 
Sent: Wednesday, February 12, 2020 1:04 PM 
To: 
Cc: 
Subject: RE: Epstein search materials for upload and privilege review 
wanted to follow up on this —  is the data fully uploaded, or did it get delayed? Thanks. 
From: 
Sent: Friday, February 07, 2020 11:25 
To: 
Cc: 
Subject: RE: Epstein search materials for upload and privilege review 
Great, thank you! 
From: 
Sent: Friday, February 07, 2020 09:34 
To: 
Cc: 
C 
Subject: RE: Epstein search materials for upload and privilege review 
The data should be ready by Monday morning. 
From: 
Sent: Tuesday, February 4, 2020 6:58 PM 
To: 
Cc: Ez>.• 
C 
C 
Subject: RE: Epstein search materials for upload and privilege review 
S.; 
S.; 
Wanted to quickly check the status of the below —  it's only been a couple weeks, so totally understand it may not be 
complete, but hopefully we're getting close? If you could please check with the vendor and let us know, we'd be 
grateful —  and we'll plan to get it to asap once we have access. 
EFTA00020841

thanks, 
From: 
Sent: Tuesday, January 21, 2020 18:50 
To: 
Cc: 
Subject: RE: Epstein search materials for upload and privilege review 
We've received a hard drive from FBI CART, which they've processed from devices seized and searched in connection 
with the Epstein case. Can we please get those materials uploaded to Relativity, for privilege review by (copied 
here)? I've left the hard drive with the materials on your chair. (And if we could please get that hard drive back once 
the materials are uploaded, the FBI has another batch they want to transmit to us for the same process, so that will 
also be coming shortly.) 
And then M, these will be subject to just the exact same privilege review you previously ran in connection with 
Epstein search warrant returns. 
Please let us know if any questions or issues at all? And thanks very much as always. 
<STR_Epstein_Privilege Terms_02. I 4.2020.pdf> 
EFTA00020842
